item.title: 자기장의 기호로 B를 사용하는 이유
item.description: Question Electromagnetism is literally the study of electric fields $\mathbf{E}$ and magnetic fields $\mathbf{B}$. While studying electromagnetism, one might have wondered the following at least once. Why is the symbol for magnetic fields $\mathbf{B}$ used? It's understandable that the electric field is $\mathbf{E}$, derived from the Electric field, but why is the magnetic field $\mathbf{B}$ when it should be from Magnetic field? This notation might feel oddly placed, and it's
